owl:Ontology.dc:creator: Serge Chávez-Feria (Ontology Engineering Group, Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
owl:Ontology.dc:description: The Building ontology has been developed to perform as the core module of the BIMERR project, containing information related to buidling topology, components, materials, and geometry. The geometry information is managed as information objects whitout entering in the details of the BIM model.
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Building ontology

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation to indicate that a storey has apartments.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has apartment

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation to link construction components (walls, floors, etc) with their internal layers.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has layer

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation to link building components (HVAC, doors, etc) with the sub-components they are conformed with.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has subcomponent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation to buildings contained in a zone. The typical domains of bot:hasBuilding are instances of bot:Site.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: contains zone

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links a Zone to an Element that is contained in, or adjacent to, the Zone. The intended use of this relationship is not to be stated explicitly, but to be inferred from its sub-properties. It will, for example, allow one to query for all the doors of a building given that they have an adjacency to spaces of the building.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has element

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation to spaces contained in a zone. The typical domains of bot:hasSpace are instances of bot:Storey and bot:Building.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has space

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation to storeys contained in a zone. The typical domains of bot:hasStorey are instances of bot:Building.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has storey

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between an element a) and another element b) hosted by element a).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has sub-element

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Maximum limit range to describe the number of occupants inside a zone.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: max number occupants

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Minimum limit range to describe the number of occupants inside a zone.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: min number occupants

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Attribute to indicate the altitud geolocalization coordinate of a building.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: altitud

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Attribute to indicate the latitud geolocalization coordinate of a building.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: latitud

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Attribute to indicate the longitud geolocalization coordinate of a building.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: longitud

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A delimited zone within a storey which brings shelter to its residents.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Apartment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A building represents a structure that provides shelter for its occupants or contents and stands in one place. The building is also used to provide a basic element within the spatial structure hierarchy for the components of a building project (together with site, storey, and space). (Definition taken from IFC4x1 standard)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Building

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents assemblies or undividible building products.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Component
Concrete with expanded clay or brick chippings aggregate

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Building component that is conformed by layers, such as a wall, roof, or floor.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Construction

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Building component or construction element which can be described by a set of properties.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Element
Insulating materials from renewable raw material

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A single and identifiable part of an element which is constructed of a number of layers (one or more). Each Layer has a constant thickness and is located relative to the referencing Construction element. (Definition adapted from IFC)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Layer

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A homogeneous or inhomogeneous substance that can be used to form elements (physical products or their components). (Definition taken from IFC)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Material
Reinforced concrete / normal concrete with reinforcement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A space is (if specified) associated to a building storey (or in case of exterior spaces to a site). A space may span over several connected spaces. Therefore a space group provides for a collection of spaces included in a storey. A space can also be decomposed in parts, where each part defines a partial space. (Definition taken from IFC standard)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A storey is (if specified) associated to a building. A storey may span over several connected storeys. Therefore storey complex provides for a collection of storeys included in a building. A storey can also be decomposed in (horizontical) parts, where each part defines a partial storey. (Definition taken from IFC standard)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Storey

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An independent unit of the built environment with a characteristic spatial structure, intended to serve at least one function or user activity [ISO-12006].
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bot:Building

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Constituent of a construction entity with a characteristic technical function, form or position [[ISO-12006], 3.4.7].
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bot:Element

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A part of the physical world or a virtual world whose 3D spatial extent is bounded actually or theoretically, and provides for certain functions within the zone it is contained in.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bot:Space

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A level part of a building.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bot:Storey

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A part of the physical world or a virtual world that is inherently both located in this world and having a 3D spatial extent.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bot:Zone
